intro: Calyptranthes elliptica, commonly known as the elliptic calyptranthes, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes well-known genera such as Eucalyptus and Syzygium. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, leathery leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The fruit is a small, capsule-like structure that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
